page.title: 09WEST FELTON FARMING
page.content: WEST FELTON IS PREDOMINANTLY A FARMING AREA WITH A NUMBER OF TENANT FARMERS ON THE TEDSMORE AND WOODHOUSE ESTATES,AND SOME LARGER PRIVATELY OWNED FARMS SUCH AS SANDFORD HALL AND PRADOE.MOST FARMS ARE MIXED WITH CATTLE,SHEEP,POTATOES AND SUGAR BEET BEING THE MAIN VARIETIES. PRADOE,BUILT IN 1785 IS TYPICAL OF THESE FARMS,AND COL. JOHN KENYON IS THE 5TH GENERATION OF KENYONS TO LIVE THERE.THE HOME FARM COMPRISES SOME 350 ACRES,AND INCLUDES POTATOES,SUGAR BEET,CEREALS,CALVES AND SUFFOLK SHEEP. PRADOE CHURCH WAS BUILT IN 1860 IN ORDER THAT PEOPLE IN THE LOCAL HAMLETS DID NOT HAVE TO WALK TOO FAR TO CHURCH.RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE UPKEEP AND RUNNING OF THE CHURCH RESTS WITH THE "TENANT-FOR-LIFE" OF PRADOE.
